pageContext.description: Edge slightly chipped. Small circular hollow worn under stop ridge ornament.
pageContext.associations: Found with 2 terra cotta urns, a stone spindle whorl, one flint celt and one stone celt (Druids Stones) at Cerrig Dwddy Llangwyllog, in a field with many tumile: urns, celts and stones have been frequently found here. These were dug up in levelling a fence about 1750 and remained in the house of the proprietor. Mr. Henry Prichard.
pageContext.publications: R.C.A.M. 57,Arch. Journal XXVII, 163, pl. X. 3,Evans Bronze, p.81
pageContext.collection: British Museum, 70.7-6.76,Given by W. Owen Stanley, 1870
